name: Sourdough and Banana Pancakes
author: Carolyn Meigs
summary: A tasty and easy breakfast for two hearty appetites! Perfect for when you need to use up some starter and have an overripe banana. I add mini chocolate chips to mine.
ingredients: ½ cup milk, or as needed
directions: Whisk flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon together in a large bowl
Stir in sourdough starter, sour cream, egg, 2 tablespoons butter, and vanilla extract
Add to the flour mixture and stir until just combined
Mix in milk gradually until batter is pourable but some lumps remain
Heat a griddle over medium-high heat
Pour 1/4 cup batter onto the griddle for each pancake, keeping them 2 inches apart
Cook until bubbles form and the edges are dry, about 2 1/2 minutes
Flip and cook until browned on the other side, about 1 minute
Repeat with remaining butter and batter
